0.user_question: Max bought stamps at the post office. Some of the stamps had a snowflake design, some had a truck design, and some had a rose design. Max bought 1796381 snowflake stamps. He bought 3 more truck stamps than snowflake stamps, and 9 fewer rose stamps than truck stamps. How many stamps did Max buy in all?

1.subquestion: How many truck stamps did Max buy if they exceeded the number of snowflake ones by exactly 3?

subanswer.text: Since Max bought 3 more truck stamps than snowflake stamps, he bought 1796381 (number of snowflake stamps) + 3 = 1796384 truck stamps. The answer is 1796384.

2.subquestion: Now we can answer the question: How many stamps did Max buy in all?

subanswer.text: In addition to the previous numbers, Max also purchased 9 fewer rose stamps than truck stamps, meaning 1796384 (truck stamps) - 9 = 1796375 rose stamps. Adding up all types together results in 1796381 (snowflake stamps) + 1796384 (truck stamps) + 1796375 (rose stamps), equating to 5392030 stamps in total. The answer is 5392030.

0.user_question: Max bought stamps at the post office. Some of the stamps had a snowflake design, some had a truck design, and some had a rose design. Max bought 1796381 snowflake stamps. He bought 3 more truck stamps than snowflake stamps, and 9 fewer rose stamps than truck stamps. How many stamps did Max buy in all?

direct_answer.text:
Firstly we need to find out how many truck stamps (T) Max bought which was T = S + 3 since it said that Max bought three more truck stamps than snowflake stamps; thus :  

Truck Stamps=1796381+3=1796384

Secondly calculate Rose stamps(R). Rockets stamp count lesses thrice when compared totphtick so ,   
     R = T - 9       =>     1796384 - 9                         = 1796375 .
Finally add up all these quantities together ;  therefore Total amount of stamps purchased=(total value)=S+(Total Value )-(Value)+(value))               =          [1]           ((1796381stamps)(Snow flake)-((1796384thanks)(truck)-((1796375rose)).
